description: This command (no query form) creates a new directory.
arguments: <directory_path> is a quoted string that specifies the directory path to create.

examples.description: creates the directory named NewDirectory at the root of the E drive.
creates the directory MyNewSubDirectory within the existing directory MyDirectory at the root of the E drive.
creates a new directory named Screenshots in the Tekscope folder on the C drive.

shortDescription: This command (no query form) creates a new directory.
notes: No query form available for this command
Directory path must be a quoted string
Use forward slashes (/) or escaped backslashes (\\) in paths
Use FILESYSTEM:CWD to change working directory before creating subdirectories
name: Mkdir

params.name: directory_path
params.description: Quoted string that specifies the directory path to create. Can be an absolute path (e.g., "E:\NewDirectory") or a relative path (e.g., "MyNewSubDirectory") if used with FILESYSTEM:CWD.
